oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sources of N2O in organic grass-clover pastures
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ambus, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Organic farming practises, and in particular dairy production systems based on grass-clover pastures are becoming increasingly abundant within Danish agriculture. Grass-clover pastures may provide a mitigation option to reduce grassland nitrous oxide (N2O) emissions (Velthof et al. 1998). The objectives of this work was to examine the relationship between N2O emissions and transformations of inorganic N in organically managed grass-clover pastures of different ages. Results from the project will be used for calibration of the FASSET whole-farm nitrogen transformation model.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Ambus, P. (2002) Sources of N2O in organic grass-clover pastures. Poster at: NJF Seminar no. 342 Agricultural soils and greenhouse gases in cool-temperate climate, Reykholt, Iceland, 31 July - 3 August 2002. [Unpublished]
